I am using GEF in combination with a ContentAssistHandler. 
Usecase: When clicking a label, a SWT Text control comes up with a ContentAssistHandler attached to it. When the user clicks on another widget, the Text loses focus, the ContentAssistHandler gets dispabled and the Text control should disappear again (gets disposed).

This causes an exception. The already disposed Text still has listeners of the ContentAssistHandler which want to work on the disposed Text.

I found out that this is probably caused by AbstractControlContentAssistSubjectAdapter, line 792 pp.

if (control.isFocusControl())				
    focuslistener.uninstall();

Why does the focusListener only get uninstalled when the Text control has focus?
Regards, Ingo

>Why does the focusListener only get uninstalled when the Text control has
>focus?
The FieldFocusListener is notified about the lost focus and uninstalls the stuff.
